how-to-play.h1: Elemendle - Guess the Periodic Table daily
how-to-play.title: How to play?
how-to-play.description: Guess today's Periodic Table element - New element every 24h
how-to-play.notes: Type any element name or symbol. The game will reveal its properties and show how close your guess was.

period.label: Period
period.description: The period of an element in the periodic table is the horizontal row it belongs to

group.label: Group
group.description: The group of an element in the periodic table is the vertical column it belongs to

block.label: Block
block.description: The block of an element in the periodic table is the type of electron shell it belongs to

phase.label: Phase(STP)
phase.description: The phase of an element in the periodic table is the state of matter it belongs to at standard temperature and pressure

mass.label: Atomic Mass
mass.description: The atomic mass of an element is the total mass of all its protons and neutrons

atomic.label: Atomic Number
atomic.description: The atomic number of an element is the number of protons in its nucleus

type.label: Type
type.description: The type of an element in the periodic table is the category it belongs to

questions.question: Do I need to create an account to play Elemendle?
questions.answer: No, Elemendle is completely free to play without any login requirements. Your progress is saved locally on your device.

questions.question: How often do elements change on Elemendle?
questions.answer: A new element is available to guess every 24 hours. Come back daily for a fresh challenge!

questions.question: How do I transfer my progress to another device?
questions.answer: Use the export feature to save your data, then import it on your new device. No account needed!

questions.question: What do the color indicators mean on Elemendle?
questions.answer: Green shows an exact match, red indicates no match, and arrows show if numeric values (like height) should be higher or lower.

questions.question: How do I get the most out of Elemendle?
questions.answer: Use the hints system after several attempts to help you guess the element. The hints are designed to help you, not hinder you.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Elemendle?
questions.answer: Elemendle is a game for the chemistry lovers, by the chemistry lovers. It is a way to keep the periodic table community together and to celebrate the periodic table.

questions.question: Do you have more play modes in the future?
questions.answer: Yes, we are working on adding more play modes to Elemendle.

questions.question: Does Elemendle have a mobile version?
questions.answer: Currently, Elemendle works across on all devices with a browser. So, you don't need to download anything.

questions.question: How's my data stored?
questions.answer: Your data is stored locally on your device. We do not collect any data from you.

questions.question: Does the Elemendle game free?
questions.answer: Yes, Elemendle is completely free to play.

questions.question: Does this Elemendle game associated with the periodic table?
questions.answer: No, Elemendle is not affiliated with the periodic table. It is a fan-made game.

questions.question: Can I provide some feedback about Elemendle?
questions.answer: You can contact us at support@elemendle.app.

content.title: Start with Popular Elements
content.description: Begin with well-known elements like Hydrogen or Oxygen to understand multiple properties at once.

content.title: Use Periodic Table Information
content.description: Pay attention to the element's properties to narrow down possibilities.

content.title: Group Properties
content.description: Focus on phase and type hints as these often group related elements together.

content.title: Watch for Patterns
content.description: Notice patterns in element properties to make more informed guesses. For example, if an element is a metal, it is likely to be a metal.

content.title: Use the Hints
content.description: Don't hesitate to use the hints system after several attempts - it's designed to help!

content.title: Property-Based Matching
content.description: Instead of guessing names, match element properties like period, group, block, type, phase, mass, and atomic number.

content.title: Comprehensive Database
content.description: Access elements from all periodic table

content.title: No Time Limits
content.description: Play at your own pace - take as many attempts as you need to find the right element. Elemendle is a game for the chemistry lovers, by the chemistry lovers.

content.title: Helpful Hints
content.description: Receive strategic hints after several attempts to help with challenging elements.

content.title: Progress Tracking
content.description: Monitor your statistics and export your data to continue playing on other devices.
